SEARCH
Package game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
game.Game
public class Game extends Object
Represents the main controller for the game logic and flow. The Game class handles player setup (human and AI), game configuration (such as difficulty level and number of players), game progression, and end-of-game conditions. It also manages user interaction via menus, audio playback, and the main game loop.

    • isTwoPlayerGame

    • setTwoPlayerGame

      public void setTwoPlayerGame(boolean isTwoPlayerGame)
      Sets the game mode to either two-player or other mode.
      Parameters:
      isTwoPlayerGame - true if the game should be set to two-player mode; false otherwise

    • setDifficulty

      public void setDifficulty(Difficulty difficulty)
      Sets the game difficulty level to either EASY, MEDIUM or HARD mode
      Parameters:
      difficulty - EASY to set the game to easy mode; MEDIUM to set the game to medium mode; HARD to set the game to hard mode

    • printMenu

      public void printMenu()
      Displays the main menu and processes user input to navigate to the selected option.

    • helpMenu

      public void helpMenu()
      Displays the game instructions and rules for the Parade card game. This help menu provides players with a detailed explanation of the game's objective, components, setup steps, gameplay mechanics, endgame conditions, and scoring rules. It also includes adjustments for two-player games. Once the instructions are printed, the method returns the player to the main menu.

    • selectHumanPlayers

      public void selectHumanPlayers()
      Allows the user to choose the number of human players (between 2 and 6) and enter a unique username for each player. Ensures that player names are not blank and there are no duplicates of existing names.

    • aiDifficultyLevel

      public void aiDifficultyLevel()
      Allows the user to choose the difficulty level for the AI game style.

    • selectAiPlayers

      public void selectAiPlayers()
      Allows the user to choose the number of AI players (between 1 and 5).

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Allows the user to choose the type of game styles.

    • multiplayerMenu

      public void multiplayerMenu()
      Allows user to choose between Host or Client.
